headline: Apple Crisp - Perfect and Easy
description: This apple dessert recipe is made with fresh, crisp apples topped with buttery cinnamon streusel, baked until golden for a quick and simple dessert.

video.description: Need to whip something up fast for dessert? This is just thing! It’s easy, sweet, and the crumble is delicious! Goes perfectly with ice cream!
video.name: Apple Crisp - Perfect and Easy

name: Apple Crisp - Perfect and Easy
recipeIngredient: 2.5 cups apples - peeled, cored, and sliced

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease an 8-inch square baking dish.

Arrange apple slices evenly in the prepared baking dish. Sift flour, sugar, cinnamon, and salt into a bowl. Cut in butter using a pastry blender, or 2 knives, until mixture resembles coarse cornmeal; sprinkle over apples.
Bake in the preheated oven until topping is golden, 40 to 45 minutes. Cool slightly before serving.

review.reviewBody: Loved this recipe. So easy and my family all love it and say it's the best apple crisp ever. I wouldn't change a thing. Perfect as is.
I love it, simple, quick and oh so good. will be making again and again.
Great recipe but I used brown sugar and less and CERTAINLY no need for salt. Add half oats as well as a change
This was delicious. I changed the sugar to 1/4 cup sugar and 1/4 cup dark brown sugar. Plenty sweet. Also, added one bag of instant oatmeal. Yummy!
Loved it added more apples than suggested and added oats.
Easy apple crisp recipe which I was I was looking for. I did add 3 cups of apples, rather than 2 1/2, but followed the remaining ingredients. It turned out exactly as I hoped. Very good recipe!
It was quick and delicious. I’m making it again this evening but adding more apples and reducing the sugar
Very good and simple. I added 1/2 cup sugar and t cinnamon to apples and 1/2 cup oatmeal to topping.
this is so easy and the best recipe yet! family loves it .

So easy and very delicious! I doubled it and used a 9x13. I sprinkled cinnamon, all spice and cloves over the apples before i put on the crumb topping. I also added vanilla to the topping and used half white, half brown sugar. Served warm with whipped topping.
Super Yummy and Super Easy!! Definitely adding this to my recipe book!

This was quick and easy, just like the title claims. While it is a simple recipe, it is scrumptious! I tried it the first time, and took it to church for fellowship (make a double batch), it was met with many compliments, and seconds... ;)

It was delicious. I modified to fit the ingredients I had in the house. I was trying to use up apples, so I doubled the recipe. I didn't have enough butter, so I used part butter and part shortening. I doubled the cinnamon by accident, but it ended up being quite nice that way.
Very easy and tastes delicious
Great recipe! Just a little too sweet for my taste. I used about 3/4 of a cup of sugar the first time baking it - I'll probably cut it down to a half cup for next time!

This was great! I doubled the apples and the topping and subbed spenda for the sugar (also added a little nutmeg) It's great with sugar free whipped cream. Will definitely make again, my family loved it!

Fabulous. I was looking for an apple crisp recipe without oatmeal. I doubled the recipe for a 9 x 13 glass pan. Used 5 large Granny Smith apples, probably 7 cups. Took the advice of many reviewers and used half sugar and have brown sugar, a capful of vanilla, and a pinch of salt. Everyone loved it and I'll be making this again and again. Thank you!

I made it. Quite easy to make, BUT not enough apples and the topping was WAY too much and way too sickeningly sweet. Next time I make it, I'll double the amount of apples and cut the topping ingredients in half.
Excellent. It was eaten very quickly! Thanks!
Perfect and Easy! This was just what I was looking for. My mother made apple crisp frequently, and I knew what was in it. I did not know how much of everything. This turned out perfectly!
Delicious!!

So easy and GREAT. I am known for my apple pies! Wasn’t sure of this recipe b/c of flour on top, but thought I would try it. Had twice the apples, so doubled the topping. Only I used 1 cup of flour and 1 cup Oatmeal. Also didn’t want to double the sugar….glad I didn’t …used 1 1/4 cup in mixture Then didn’t really want 2 sticks of butter, so used the one (cut up cold in tiny squares and worked quickly through the dough) and about (didn’t measure) 1/2 cups of sliced almonds cut up more with my pastry blender and sprinkled on top. Then topped the mixture with extra cinnamon and sugar (like I do my pie crusts). EXCELLENT. My husband who prefers my pie to ANY crisp….almost won him over. This was so crunchy….even next day. I did bake it about an hour! THANK YOU for sharing. LOVE Love this recipe!
I made this exactly as written and it was divine!!! Thanks!!!!
This is indeed an easy and perfect dessert. Perfect warm dessert for a winter night. Thanks for sharing.
Delicious! It's a bit too sweet and had extra topping left over. I add extra, extra apples and slightly less sugar. Can't take too much sugar as it didn't bake right.
I was disappointed with this recipe--I think it needs oatmeal and less sugar.
Delish! Though the ratio is off -- double the apples or cut the crumble in half.
Half white sugar & half brown sugar tasted better. I have also used apple pie spice in place of just cinnamon and it was delicious! Definitely amazing over ice cream!

this was delicious! a couple small changes! Sugar 3/4c instead of the whole cup and add more apples to use all that delicious topping! maybe another cup of apples at least. and use a little bigger of a pan, I used a pie plate! thanks for a quick easy delicious recipe!
I loved it. Tastes like Grandma used to make!
This was really good! My family loved it.
It was so good, I added chopped pecans for a little extra crunch and flavor. Everyone loved it. Going to be on my Thanksgiving dessert table.
I forgot to take a picture! It is super easy however.... I don't think I made the crumble correct! I will try again over the weekend. I think mine was too powdery. But the flavor was still there!!
So simple but still tastes awesome
loved this!! Quick and easy. Substituted sugar for Splenda as I rarely have sugar on hand and it was DELICIOUS!!!

This was very easy and quick. The only thing I’d change is the amount of sugar—it was over the top sugary. (Unless of course you like your desserts with sugar-crunch?) Next time I’ll halve that ingredient.
mmmmmmm
easy, tasty, made several times
This was pretty easy, and fun to make, and very tasty to!

I made this for my husband as a surprise. Apple Crisp is his favorite dessert. I've never made it before, as a matter of fact, I'm disabled & in pain daily so he never expected it! I added grape nuts to make it extra crispy. End result...He LOVED IT!!! I served it with vanilla bean ice cream and a touch of cinnamon on top. "Mmm, delicious, if I say so myself!" If I could give it ten stars, I would!
My friend and I baked 2. Doubled the recipe and split it up. Baked perfectly. Very easy and delicious.
Easy and yum!
Instead of white sugar, I used 3/4 cup brown sugar. It came out delicious!
Loved the taste. I did add more cinnamon, my preference. Definitely could use more apples next time.
It was delicious and easy
I followed everything that’s indicated over here and it turned out very nice. I love it! And this was my first attempt
Very easy. Made with 5 red delicious apples and about 2/3 cup of sugar instead of 1 cup.
Easy & excellent!
Super Easy recipe to follow with just a few ingredients.My daughter and i had a fun time making this

Very good. I doubled the recipe using a 9x13 pan and used canned apple pie filling on one side and a 15 oz can of sliced, drained peaches on the other since my husband only likes apple and I wanted peach (quarantine cuisine). Maybe it was because I used pie filling which is already sweet, and canned peaches that were already in juice, but even taking that into consideration, the topping by itself was very, very sweet. If I make it again, I will cut back on the sugar, maybe to 2/3 cup.

good recipe to finish our overflowing granny smith apples... i doubled the amount of apples . the topping for us was enough for 2 6 cups rectangle pyrex. 

also lessened the sugar to 1/2 cup as we tr y to lessen sugary treats at our home.
Tasted awesome
The apples tasted great but the topping was way too much! Could easily cut the amount by two thirds of what the recipe calls for
This is a great quick and simple recipe! The only change I would make is use 1/2 cup or 3/4 cup sugar... it was a little too sweet for me!
My kids loved it, I added more apples.

No changes, well a wee bit more cinnamon.
Will make again
This was easy and delicious! Served warm with vanilla ice cream. My wife and I loved it. We didn’t waste our time peeling the apples. It was great with the skin on.
Cook for less time if using granny Smith apples.
Quick easy way to use extra apples. Delicious
Absolutely delicious! Will be making this again. My pan was 9x9, so I used more apples.
Easiest dessert I’ve ever made and it’s delicious! I added some instant oats to the crisp mixture- ended up amazing!
It has too much sugar and not enough spice. Next time I might try adding more apples and less sugar.

Great staple recipe with no hassle ingredients that most people have on hand. I always read the reviews before making a recipe to see if there is a standing theme that works for most people. Here's what I found. 

I used an 8 X 8 glass pan, lightly greased, 6 medium apples, peeled, sliced and layered (I found this amount to be perfect and mine came almost 1/2 way in the pan). I made the topping with all the measurements EXACT with ONE change - I used 1/2 cup brown sugar and 1/2 cup white sugar and tossed in a cap full of vanilla extract. It makes the topping look so pretty when cooked, a nice golden color.

The baking time is exact, along with the temp for my stove. This is a sweet dish, it's a dessert. Make it once as is, if it's too sweet for you, lower the sugar amount. We found it perfect and every one I've made a dish and sent one too has raved it's perfect as is.
good, just a bit too sweet
Wow this was absolutely delicious. I thought I was going to mess it up but I didn't. It came out really good and my family loved it. I highly recommend it.
I made the recipe exactly as written. There were not enough apples and there was way too much topping, way too much sugar. I think it could be tasty if the proportions were different.
Used light brown sugar instead, a little lemon juice on the apples, and topped it with fresh, chilled whipped cream
Because of the shelter in place order I had to use what was in the pantry. I used Bisquick in place of flour and it was still crunchy and delicious.
A little too sweet, but a great recipe. I will decrease the sugar a bit and I will double cinnamon next time.

Delicious as is!

This is my go-to recipe, however I usually add 1/2 cup (+/-) special dark chocolate chips to the apples for a little bit of chocolately goodness. Yummm!
Fabulous! Quick. And easy!

I made it with 1 cup Pamela's gluten free baking mix instead of flour. I did not sift my dry ingredients, and I cubed my cold butter. I also used a blender on low (stopping and punching in several times) to incorporate until crumbly. My oven cooks hot so 350 for 40 mins was perfect. I loved the simple number of ingredients. I used pink lady organic apples.
This is amazing!!! My first time making apple crisp ever. Definitely going to make again! thanks. I added an extra apple.
This recipe is delicious! I used 1/2 a cup of sugar and tossed the apples in a tablespoon of vanilla. It was plenty sweet and a crowd pleaser! Thanks for sharing!!!
Added some brown sugar to the mixture! Was perfect
My granddaughter loved it she has an dairy allergen
Easy to make and was a big hit with my dinner guests!
Crust to apples ratio way off. Way to much crust and too sugary. Maybe try 1/3 crust ingredients or 3x the apples.
Comes together quickly. Delicious. Doubled the apples. Everything else the same. Will make again.
yummy!

This really is the best apple crisp. I love brown sugar and oats and always made my crisp with both. But I had some picky eaters so I tried this version and had to leave out the cinnamon too. I was shocked how much better apple crisp is without those 3 delicious ingredients. It gave it a clean, fresh quality and it was definitely better, but isn’t that a counterintuitive outcome!? I wouldn’t have believe taking out my favorite ingredients would make something better but it really did.
 I used honey crisp apples, btw.
Stellar! I lightly drizzled with caramel while still hot from the oven, and it blew my mind. I have limited baking skills, but this is an un-botchable recipe.

Perfect, but hubby wants double crumbs the next time I make it. LoL but I loved it with vanilla ice cream, it took me back in time. Thank you for sharing this recipe. It is my go to any fruit crisp, I really want make this with blueberries ,, yummy yum yum!
Need tasty apples. Will add apple pie spices to add flavor.
So simple and so yummy!
Simple recipe and great results! We LOVED IT!!!!

I loved it. Was surprised at how good it tasted. The first was a little too sweet because I did not add too much apples, but the second time I made it I added more apples and some other fruits along w/ it. I am happy about how it all came out. It truly is simple and easy!
Delicious! i added oats on top and ate it hot, family favorite and famous!
Simple, quick, and delicious! Topped it with vanilla ice cream while still warm, so yummy!

This was so delicious and so easy to make! I used 8 small/ medium sized apples and I think that was the perfect amount for the amount of topping. I actually could have used less sugar because the apples were Galas, but it was still super good. I also added a half teaspoon of vanilla. I'll definitely make it again and probably try it with peaches also.
I have made it many times and remains a fav of my family.
I did 1/4 cup white sugar, 1/4 cup cane sugar and a half cup brown sugar. It came out awesome. I will make it again.
This recipe turned out great! It was very easy and very sweet! My husband loved it! Used fresh apples from the orchard. Will be making it again.
Easy great taste. Family loved it. Oh first apple crisp ever yeah for me
This is so SIMPLE n taste FABULOUS I actually just made another one today ... it’s n the oven ...
I still dumbfounded as to how simple and delicious this. Amazing

I used brown sugar instead and a pinch of baking powder. Than i put aside 3/4 of the mixture.>sprinkled mixture in bottom of glass baking dish>arranged apples evenly>alternated layers> crumbled the reserved mixture on top.
This came out perfect!! I used Honeycrisp apples and the topping was awesome!! Just the right amount of crunch! Will be making it again this weekend. Hubby loved it!!!
Very easy and fast. We LOVED it!
